description:
Founded in 2014, Prenetics is a major global diagnostics and genetic testing company with the mission to bring health closer to millions of people globally and decentralize healthcare by making the three pillars — Prevention, Diagnostics and Personalized Care — comprehensive and accessible to anyone, at anytime and anywhere. Prenetics is led by visionary entrepreneur, Danny Yeung, with a team of over 800 employees and operations across 9 locations, including United Kingdom, Hong Kong, India, South Africa, and Southeast Asia. Prenetics develops consumer genetic testing and early colorectal cancer screening; provides COVID-19 testing, rapid point of care and at-home diagnostic testing and medical genetic testing.

Most recently, Prenetics made international headlines to become the first Unicorn in Hong Kong to publicly list on the Nasdaq via merger with 2021 Adrian Cheng's Artisan Acquisition Corp, valuing Prenetics at approximately US $1.7b.

Make a difference to the community! Let's fight COVID-19 together for Hong Kong and make Hong Kong safe again. This is a unique opportunity to make a difference to the community and to play a role to fight COVID-19 here in Hong Kong. The faster we identify, the faster we can stop the virus chain! Please note that all safety guidelines and protocols will be met to ensure safety for everyone. Join us as a Registered Nurse and make a difference today! 

This position will begin with a 6-months contract and with the potential opportunity to extend the contract to a permanent role after organizational and performance review when the initial 6-month period ends.

Key Responsibilities

Responsible for conducting sample collection on site by "CNTS/NS" method
Execute operation training
Review procedure to ensure all operations fulfill the guideline



Job Requirements

Holder of Registered Nurse License with valid practicing certificate
Familiar with Infection Control Guideline
Good communication and problem-solving skills
Experience in NS and CNTS
Immediate availability is an advantage
Competitive hourly remuneration will be provided



Our DNA is P-R-E-N-E-T-I-C-S. See what each word of our company name means:

Passion

You love what you do and accomplish amazing result
You spread positivity, bring enthusiasm to work and inspire team members
You drive team toward specific goals, even when they seem unlikely or difficult

Resilience

You embrace changes and be able to drive through uncertainty, ambiguity and uncomfortable situations
You bounce back quickly from setbacks and challenges
You are persistent and determined to achieve the desired outcome

Empowerment

You trust others to play their positions well like an elite sports team
You foster a strong team spirit while encouraging others to take initiatives and risks
You create a space to allow team to grow and hold each other accountable

iNtegrity

You are trustworthy and lead by example
You are consistent in your message and action all the times
You deliver what you have promised

Epic

You challenge your own comfort zone and always outperform yourself
You make meaningful and amazing impact to the world
You dare to take risks and you move fast

Transparency

You are completely honest and committed to giving candid feedbacks, no matter how challenging it might be
You share ideas, knowledge and skills that empower others and create access to information with the wider team
You share wins and failures openly

Ingenuity

You make sound judgement and come up with solutions that are creative and smart. Copy when feasible
You challenge the status quo and question things that could be done differently for better. Modify the wheel if you can’t change it
You think outside of the box and make value-based innovation

Communications

You articulate your thoughts and ideas effectively and respectfully
You know your audience and talk in a way they want to be told
You make sure communications happens, no matter where you are

Selflessness

You put the needs of others before one's own and find ways in helping other to succeed
You focus on team wins than personal wins and share credits
You act in the company's best interest
We are Prenetics, our people make us who we are.

description:
Clinical Assistant at Skincentral

Why Should You Join Us?

We are one of the largest dermatology specialist clinics in Hong Kong. We give you options and possibilities to the freedom to believe in what you believe.  We are a family guided by shared values and a commitment. We are a group of people with growth mindset who are always ready to tackle challenges and value the opportunities to solve complex problems. We are a passionate team who are committed to provide the highest quality possible to our clients. If this sounds exciting to you, Welcome to Skincentral.

You have a purpose, unique talents and NOW is the time to embrace it, live it and put it to work. At Skincentral, we value incredible people with incredible skills -but your commitment to a greater cause is something we value even more. This is the heartbeat of our organization and your time will be spent in a supportive, team environment with resources to help you flourish.

Skincentral’s Clinical Assistants are highly-valued and professional team members with an important voice in this organization.  In this role, you will help to perform a variety of medical and cosmetic procedures, as well as certain clerical services. We are looking for an attentive and dedicated individual, with a fine-tuned sense of responsibility, the ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented atmosphere, and a commitment to delivering the highest quality medical and cosmetic care to our valued clients.

What You Can Bring To Us? 

Assist Doctors with medical, cosmetic consultations procedures
Perform  routine clinical and administrative tasks to assist with keeping the clinic running smoothly
Educate patients about pertinent treatment and procedures
Assist patients with their enquiries on various communication channels
Front desk duties- be the faces of Skincentral that we can be proud of

We need individuals who possess the following skillsets:

Excellent customer service skills
Strong interpersonal skills  
A good command of English, Cantonese & Putonghua (written and spoken) 
Ability to work under high pressure and a good team player
A growth mindset to pick up new skills and knowledge quickly
Genuine interests in the field of medical and aesthetics treatments

Skincentral offers our people a true opportunity to live their calling to care while experiencing the support of a comprehensive network, professional growth, trusted leadership, generous benefits and an amazing quality of life with an attractive clinic location at Central. We are proud to provide high quality service to our clients through state-of-the-art technology, clinical resources and professional expertise with a patient-centered approach that emphasizes Skincentral's mission and commitment to quality, compassion and service.

[Ref: CT-TRN]

The Job:

Coordinate, implement and evaluate health care policies and nursing protocols; infection control procedures; reporting and handling epidemic outbreak of infectious disease for the operation of the respective Residential Care Home for the Elderly or Day Care Centre or Home Care Support Services.
Assist Nursing Manager to oversee and monitor the health care and service standards provided to residents as well as staff supervision including duty roster, training and performance monitoring.
Maintain and carry out integrity of drug and medical equipment stock; coordinate and arrange different allied healthcare professionals to design and provide services according to resident’s care needs, etc.
Participate and supervise nursing routines and on-going monitoring of the individual care plan for residents.
Coordinate pre-admission logistics including visits and preparation of the facilities allocation for admission.
Manage emergency call and provide home care support services; handle enquiries, feedback and complaints from stakeholders.
Shift and on call duties are required, long night shift staff will entitle shift allowance.

 The Person:

5 passes in HKCEE, including English (Syl. B) and Chinese Language OR 5 subjects obtained Level 2 or above in HKDSEE, including English and Chinese.
Valid practicing certificate (RN) issued by the Nursing Council of Hong Kong. Certificate of Infection Control and Gerontology preferred.
Minimum 5 years relevant working experience in residential elderly services including 3 years at management position preferred.

Attractive remuneration package will be offered to suitable candidates. To apply, please submit online application: https://careers.hkhs.com/ or send your application with full resume and reference quoted to Human Resources Manager by fax: 2882 4466.

You are welcome to visit our website www.hkhs.com to learn more about us.
Applicants not invited for interview within 8 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful.

Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the Housing Society’s personal data policies which is available in our website and obtainable upon request. Please refer to the Policy Statement on Employment Related Data under Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance in our website.

description:

Bachelor of Nursing with a valid Nursing Practicing Certificate

Diploma holder in Enterostomal Therapy Nursing OR Certificate holder of Stoma & Wound Care from IANS is an advantage

Community Nursing Experience is an advantage

Independent, pleasant and outgoing personality with good interpersonal communication skills
Proficiency in verbal and written English & Chinese. Fluency in Putonghua will be an advantage
Hands on PC knowledge

Job Responsibilities:

Provide quality clinical duties and administration work
Work with the team on consultation and handle stoma and wound care procedures independently
Handle patients' enquiries and case follow-up
Deliver educational talks to clients and medical professionals
Good decision making, interpersonal and communication skills

Attractive remuneration, medical allowance & fringe benefits will be offered to right candidates. Please send full resume & expected salary by clicking "Apply Now".

Short listed candidates will be invited for interview. All information received will be kept in strict confidence and for employment-related purpose only.

ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations.

With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life.

Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well.

Here at ICON we want our employees to succeed and we enable this success through consistent training, development and support. To be successful in this position you will have: 

A proven track record as a highly motivated and dynamic project management professional
Ability and skills to manage end to end performance for assigned protocols in a country, processes (and controls), productivity, quality and project delivery
Proficiency in written and spoken English and local language. The incumbent must be competent and effective in written and verbal communication.
Ability to identify problems, conflicts and opportunities early and lead, analyse and prepare mitigation plans and drive conflict resolution is critical

You are:

Passionate, innovative and committed.

Here at ICON we want our employees to succeed and ensure that they are set up for this success through constant training, development and support. To enable success in this position you will have:

Prior experience of working in investigator site management, including conducting monitoring visits, from either a pharmaceutical company or a CRO environment.
A working knowledge of ICH-GCP guidelines and local and international regulatory requirements is essential.
You will be educated to degree level in a life science discipline or be a licensed healthcare professional.
Experience working on Oncology trials or complex studies would be an advantage for this role. 

Benefits of Working in ICON:

description:
SCHOOL OF NURSING

Clinical Instructor in General Nursing (three posts) (Ref. 22011303)

Duties

The appointees will be required to:

(a) supervise clinical projects and clinical practicum at undergraduate level;

(b) teach pre-registration nursing programmes and supervise students in clinical/field studies;

(c) coordinate student clinical placement with local, national and overseas healthcare agencies;

(d) act as student advisor and counsellor; and

(e) perform any other duties as assigned by the Head of School or his/her delegates.

Qualifications

Applicants should have:

(a) a master’s degree in Nursing with at least three years’ relevant post-registration clinical experience at local hospitals;

(b) a Certificate of Registration (Part I) issued by The Nursing Board/Council of Hong Kong;

(c) a valid practicing certificate issued by The Nursing Council of Hong Kong; and

(d) a good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese, and fluency in Cantonese. 

[Applicants who have responded to the previous advertisements need not re-apply.]

description:
The Global Medical Organization leads the integration of functional and geographic expertise and product strategy into the global medical affairs plan and product network decisions

This Hematology Global Platform Medical Director position is responsible for
Support platform-specific (Hematology) ex-US (JAPAC) market Medical strategy, programs and activities (e.g. launch readiness, pipeline, clinical and LCM, data dissemination, OL engagement)
• Shape strategies to develop and disseminate Medical information that support appropriate use of Amgen products globally
• Support prioritized platform-specific ex-US needs with ongoing Medical activities and coordination of resources
Provide feedback & support clinical programs (e.g. CDP, key evidence generation); support development with pipeline trial execution
• Engage OLs on Medical topics and sci. discourse to ensure appropriate patient outcomes
• Coordinate, prioritize, and manage communication/requests from Global cross-functions to affiliates and from affiliates to global
• Partner with markets and GRAAS to support regulatory and compliance issues which may require global attention
• Communication and integrate actionable scientific insights into global strategy
• Support execution of programs and integrate Medical input globally
• Connect platform-level in-market medical issues or questions with Global capability clusters
• Support shaping of healthcare ecosystem to ensure positive patient outcomes and implement Globally led disease state education
• Support launch readiness, LCM and evidence generation
• Partner with MSL teams on integrating strategic insights to deliver Medical inputs into relevant cross-functional platform strategies
Basic Qualifications

MD/PhD/PharmD AND four () years of biopharma experience in medical affairs or clinical research

OR

MD or DO degree from an accredited medical school with completed hematology/oncology fellowship

Preferred Qualifications

Hematological malignancies experience

Asia Pacific medical affairs experience

Experience with stakeholder engagement and interactions (eg. opinion leaders, advocacy groups, payers)

In-depth understanding of scientific method and clinical applications based on medical, scientific and practical rationale

Knowledge of pharmaceutical product development, product lifecycle and commercialization process with advanced understanding of other functions; including, but not limited to, Clinical research, Commercial, Regulatory, Real World Evidence and biostatistics

Sound scientific/medical judgment

Excellent communication skills

Track record of success working with matrix cross-functional teams

Join Us

If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.

Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.

As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.

description:
公司簡介：

公司成立於2007年，相信中醫專業的生命力在於社區，十餘年來專注發展社區中醫所，以建立家庭中醫師體系為目標，宏道揚德。現有30餘所社區中醫診所，60餘位全職中醫師。我們認為，香港中醫行業專業水平的差異很大，優秀及具專業精神的中醫師是稀少的。我們希望能為香港培養有抱負而優秀的中醫師，貢獻社區，推動中醫發展；同時，我們亦希望以我們的力量，為優秀的中醫師提供備受尊重及良好發展的空間。
職位內容：

此職位適合希望獨立應診，以優秀醫療技術服務大眾、積累病人、並獲得優秀回報的醫師。公司設有清晰的職級升遷階梯及完善的職涯規劃，為醫師創建穩定的臨證環境及職崖進階規劃，提供具尊嚴的薪酬方案，讓醫師得以專注於專業發展。
公司不要求銷售產品、套票療程、沒有營業額要求；但要求醫師中西醫知識並俱，不排斥現代醫學檢查方法，對治療方法及醫學知識持開放及客觀的態度，不推症、撿症及提早截症，以病人為先。

職位：主治中醫師
職責：全科中醫診療 (方藥、針灸、傷科外敷)
資歷：學位課程畢業；2年以上經驗；良好粵語，一般普通話，一般英語優先；熱忱醫療服務工作，具良好醫患溝通能力，獨立而努力工作。
待遇：底薪每月$35,000 - $42,000 (按經驗、能力及每週工作日數)，另加佣金提成銀行假，有薪年假，在職培訓，晉升機會

description:
Role & Responsibilities:

· Run an injury rehabilitation programme based on the company’s own innovative model and work with a team of insurance professionals

· Provide high standard and timely services in accordance with the agreed Business Protocols and/or any specific services standards

· Raise the profile of the company’s claims servicing – both internal and external, e.g. to attend survey and meetings, prepare and present claims analysis with clients etc.

· Proactively provide claims management services to clients independently, such as Employees’ Compensation / Personal Injury case management

· Communicate and liaise with clients, insurers, injured person(s), Government Departments, and medical professionals

· Actively follow up on all injured person(s)' rehabilitation progress regularly and update claims system to ensure no delay

· Manage client accounts on claims management side independently

· Assist in improving quality and efficiency of case management work, including workflow, claims system, rehabilitation status reports and medical panel recruitment

Job Requirements:

· Degree holder in health or para-medical areas, e.g. physiotherapy, nursing, occupational therapy

· At least 1 years relevant experience; experience in clinical settings is an advantage

· Excellent command of written and spoken English and Chinese. Proficiency in speaking Putonghua is an advantage

· Good knowledge of Employees’ Compensation Ordinance, injuries management and recovery processes

· Self-motivated with good time management and prioritizing skills

· Ability to work in a team environment

· Good interpersonal and relationship development skills

· PC literate in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint

· Candidates with more experience may be considered as Senior Consultant



We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Visit us at www.marsh.com/hk.

All information received will be kept in strict confidence and be used only for employment-related purposes.
selling_points: Open to Nursing/ Occupational Therapy Graduate

ERM has enduring values, which are fundamental to our business conduct. We are passionate about our people, their safety, well-being and development. ERMers take accountability, are client focused, and collaborate with colleagues across geographies. If you share our values, believe in sustainability and are motivated by opportunities to shape, build, and contribute to a team that makes a real impact to our client’s businesses, ERM is the right place for you.

Primary Responsibilities
• Manages a Proposal Team across APAC, and provides coaching, mentoring and developmental guidance to the staff to grow their skill sets. Manages the workload of Proposal Team, and ensures equal distribution of work and responsibilities across the team.
• Creates proposal strategy and value propositions for multiple sectors and clients.
• Co-Leads the Go-No-Go Process with the Top Opp Sponsor and Partner in Charge. Influences the Partners on which opportunities are worth pursing through strategic and commercial alignment discussions.
• Responsible for the quality and consistency of the Company’s professional image in all client communications, proposals, and other related collateral.
• Directs, creates and publishes market-specific presentations, project-specific qualifications material, and develop and implement proposal and qualifications strategies.
• Coordinates administrative resourcing across APAC for local proposal support.
• Creates proposal and other related best practices to use across APAC, and provides training internally and to administrative resources in those areas.
• Interfaces with firm leadership across APAC to incorporate new strategy elements in the proposal process.
Specific Responsibilities
• Top Opportunity Process: Supports the Top opp Director in the selection of new opportunities into the Top Opp and as appropriate the Bid Management Process. Leads Top Opp win and loss analysis and reporting and supporting of Top opp reviews across the APAC BUs.
• Opportunity Review/Tracking: Tracks opportunities using company tools and methods, and reports on status including new opportunity entry, opportunity stage, opportunity pipeline and wins and losses. Reviews and evaluates requests for SOQs, proposals, presentations, and brochures.
• Qualifications: Assembles general and project-specific information regarding the company’s qualifications and experience. Provides input for RFPs, RFIs, SOQs, and presentations.
• Proposal Planning: Prepares preliminary plans for responding to RFPs, including value propositions, internal SME inclusion, proposal schedule, and identifies key proposal staff. Collaborates with Business Development and operations to develop themes, strategies. Assembles proposal teams and establishes red team reviewers. Also identifies the correct resources, whether marketing or administrative, to lead or assist in the task.
• Marketing/Commercial Strategy: Ability to support the implementation of commercial strategies based on company direction and focus on opportunities linked to strategic go-to-market campaigns.
• Return on Investment / Client Feedback: Develops programs and campaigns that showcase business value; solicit client feedback through client interactions and/or key client teams and implement changes based on feedback.
• Branding: Ensures compliance with company image, signature standards and guidelines.
• Marketing Database: Supports APAC Marketing Director with the creation and materials linked to proposal development needs such as template proposals, project experience, case studies, CVs and partnering company information.
• Best Practices: Identifies, optimizes and shares best commercial/opportunity development practices across the proposal and marketing team. Ensures consistent methods and tools are used by team members. Actively solicits feedback on processes from team and consultants.
• Special Assignments: May research, analyze, and edit non-technical white papers.
• Inter-Group Communications: Facilitates communication with other groups or entities to obtain company-wide qualification and experience information, technical input, boilerplate, etc.
Education

Minimum Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Engineering/Science or related field from an accredited college or university or demonstrated equivalent.
• MBA, a plus
Experience
10+ years of experience in Professional Services Marketing Management and Proposals Management
5+ years of experience as a supervisor in a marketing management role
• Experience managing local and remote staff
Extensive experience with MS Office Products (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
• Experience with Adobe Creative Suite a plus
• Experience with Salesforce or another equivalent CRM database
• Limited business travel required
Job Requirements
• Experience in environmental consulting or architecture and/or engineering firm.
• Broad knowledge of a program management, sales and marketing
• Over 10 years of progressive, related experience, including 5 years of managerial experience
• Maintains effective internal and external clients or user relationships within own area of responsibility
• Strong Organizational and communication skills, writing/researching/editing, and time management skills in order to juggle multiple proposals/tasks with differing deadlines.
Who We Are

As the world’s leading sustainability consulting firm, ERM is uniquely positioned to contribute to the environment and society through the expertise and energy of our employees worldwide. Sustainability is what we do, and is at the heart of both our service offerings and how we operate our business. For our people, our vision means attracting, inspiring, developing and rewarding our people to work with the best clients and on the biggest challenges, thus creating valuable careers. We achieve our vision in a sustainable manner by maintaining and living our ERM values that include Accountability, Caring for our People, Client Focus, Collaboration, Empowerment, and Transparency.

ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status or disability status.

Thank you for your interest in ERM.

description:
Pet Space Group is Hong Kong’s largest veterinary group with 10 hospitals/clinics and has a flagship hospital in Singapore as well as an established mobile ultrasound team. 

“Medutainment” is our unique approach of supporting both pets and pet owners through medical care education and entertainment while providing a high standard of hospitality and customer service.

As a result of our growth over the past year, we are looking to further grow our veterinary team and seeking for candidates for the following position at our hospitals/clinics.

Join us if you have the passion to grow your career with the largest veterinary group in the region, joining our team of 32 vets and 107 supporting staff across the group.


Vet Nurse Trainer 

Duties:

Lead and manage effective teaching and learning within classroom and clinic
Develop and implement assessment processes and tools that meet industry skills standards
Develop effective working relationships with students, client groups and staff by participating in team meetings, industry groups and student events
Contribute to development, implementation and review of educational programs
General administration including managing student attendance, progression and feedback 

Requirements:

Current industry skills and knowledge directly relevant to the training and assessments being provided
AIRC Certificate IV would be preferred
Possess strong interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with various stakeholders
Be self-motivated and able to work under pressure
Proficiency with Microsoft Office
Excellent Communication & Presentable Skills
Speak fluent Cantonese and English
5 years veterinary nursing experience

工作範圍:

接待病人、解答顧客查詢，接聽日常電話
處理客人檔案,治療室物品管理, 處理療程前和療程後照片等職務
為客人進行療程
協助醫生診治及一般文書處理
協助醫生提供療程前和療程後之程序 (如激光﹐botox等)

職位要求:

具有良好溝通技巧和團隊合作精神
有診所相關經驗者優先
待人有禮、熱情主動、對客戶服務有熱誠
懂基本電腦操作

香港上市公司500強
薪酬升幅可達30%
高達20日假期
無需OT
明確晉升階梯
